00025 #define threadID() pthread_self()

00030 //! Lock mutex during its life time.
00031 template <class Mutex>
00032 struct XScopedLock
00033 {
00034     explicit XScopedLock(Mutex &mutex) : m_mutex(mutex) {
00035         m_mutex.lock();
00036     }
00037     ~XScopedLock() {
00038         m_mutex.unlock();
00039     }
00040 private:
00041     Mutex &m_mutex;
00042 };
00043 
00044 //! Lock mutex during its life time.
00045 template <class Mutex>
00046 struct XScopedTryLock
00047 {
00048     explicit XScopedTryLock(Mutex &mutex) : m_mutex(mutex) {
00049         m_bLocking = m_mutex.trylock();
00050     }
00051     ~XScopedTryLock() {
00052         if(m_bLocking) m_mutex.unlock();
00053     }
00054     bool operator!() const {
00055         return !m_bLocking;
00056     }
00057     operator bool() const {
00058         return m_bLocking;
00059     }
00060 private:
00061     Mutex &m_mutex;
00062     bool m_bLocking;
00063 };

00068 //typedef XAdaptiveSpinLock XMutex;
00069 typedef XPthreadMutex XMutex;
00070 typedef XPthreadCondition XCondition;
00071 
00072 //! recursive mutex.
00073 class XRecursiveMutex
00074 {
00075 public:
00076     XRecursiveMutex() {
00077         m_lockingthread = (threadid_t)-1;
00078     }
00079     ~XRecursiveMutex() {}
00080 
00081     void lock() {
00082         if(!pthread_equal(m_lockingthread, threadID())) {
00083             m_mutex.lock();
00084             m_lockcount = 1;
00085             m_lockingthread = threadID();
00086         }
00087         else
00088             m_lockcount++;
00089     }
00090     //! unlock me with locking thread.
00091     void unlock() {
00092         m_lockcount--;
00093         if(m_lockcount == 0) {
00094             m_lockingthread = (threadid_t)-1;
00095             m_mutex.unlock();
00096         }
00097     }
00098     //! \return true if locked.
00099     bool trylock() {
00100         if(!pthread_equal(m_lockingthread, threadID())) {
00101             if(m_mutex.trylock()) {
00102                 m_lockcount = 1;
00103                 m_lockingthread = threadID();
00104             }
00105             else
00106                 return false;
00107         }
00108         else
00109             m_lockcount++;
00110         return true;
00111     }
00112     //! \return true if the current thread is locking mutex.
00113     bool isLockedByCurrentThread() const {
00114         return pthread_equal(m_lockingthread, threadID());
00115     }
00116 private:
00117     XMutex m_mutex;
00118     threadid_t m_lockingthread;
00119     int m_lockcount;
00120 };
00121 
00122 //! create a new thread.
00123 template <class T>
00124 class XThread
00125 {
00126 public:
00127     /*! use resume() to start a thread.
00128      * \p X must be super class of \p T.
00129      */
00130     template <class X>
00131     XThread(const shared_ptr<X> &t, void *(T::*func)(const atomic<bool> &));
00132     ~XThread() {terminate();}
00133     //! resume a new thread.
00134     void resume();
00135     /*! join a running thread.
00136      * should be called before destruction.
00137      * \param retval a pointer to return value from a thread.
00138      */
00139     void waitFor(void **retval = 0L);
00140     //! set termination flag.
00141     void terminate();
00142     //! fetch termination flag.
00143     bool isTerminated() const {return m_startarg->is_terminated;}
00144 private:
00145     pthread_t m_threadid;
00146     struct targ{
00147         shared_ptr<targ> this_ptr;
00148         shared_ptr<T> obj;
00149         void *(T::*func)(const atomic<bool> &);
00150         atomic<bool> is_terminated;
00151     };
00152     shared_ptr<targ> m_startarg;
00153     static void * xthread_start_routine(void *);
00154 };
00155 
00156 template <class T>
00157 template <class X>
00158 XThread<T>::XThread(const shared_ptr<X> &t, void *(T::*func)(const atomic<bool> &))
00159     : m_startarg(new targ)
00160 {
00161     m_startarg->obj = dynamic_pointer_cast<T>(t);
00162     ASSERT(m_startarg->obj);
00163     m_startarg->func = func;
00164     m_startarg->is_terminated = false;
00165 }
00166 
00167 template <class T>
00168 void
00169 XThread<T>::resume()
00170 {
00171     m_startarg->this_ptr = m_startarg;
00172     int ret =
00173         pthread_create((pthread_t*)&m_threadid, NULL,
00174                        &XThread<T>::xthread_start_routine , m_startarg.get());
00175     dbgPrint(QString("New Thread 0x%1.").arg((unsigned int)m_threadid, 0, 16));
00176     ASSERT(!ret);
00177 }
00178 template <class T>
00179 void *
00180 XThread<T>::xthread_start_routine(void *x)
00181 {
00182     shared_ptr<targ> arg = ((targ *)x)->this_ptr;
00183     if(g_bMLockAlways) {
00184         if(( mlockall(MCL_CURRENT | MCL_FUTURE ) == 0)) {
00185             dbgPrint("MLOCKALL succeeded.");
00186         }
00187         else{
00188             dbgPrint(formatString("MLOCKALL failed."));
00189         }
00190     }
00191     if(g_bUseMLock)
00192         mlock(&arg, 8192uL); //reserve stack.
00193 
00194     arg->this_ptr.reset();
00195     void *p = ((arg->obj.get())->*(arg->func))(arg->is_terminated);
00196     arg->obj.reset();
00197 
00198     return p;
00199 }
00200 template <class T>
00201 void 
00202 XThread<T>::waitFor(void **retval)
00203 {
00204     pthread_join(m_threadid, retval);
00205 //  ASSERT(!ret);
00206 }
00207 template <class T>
00208 void 
00209 XThread<T>::terminate()
00210 {
00211     m_startarg->is_terminated = true;
00212 }

00214 #endif
